definitions.definition: a formal examination of evidence before a judge, and typically before a jury, in order to decide guilt in a case of criminal or civil proceedings.
examples: the newspaper accounts of the trial
synonyms: retrial "the trial is expected to last several weeks"

definitions.definition: a test of the performance, qualities, or suitability of someone or something.
examples: clinical trials must establish whether the new hip replacements are working
synonyms: dry run "the product is undergoing clinical trials"

definitions.definition: an athletic contest to test the ability of players eligible for selection to a team.
an event in which horses, dogs, or other animals compete or perform.
a person, thing, or situation that tests a person's endurance or forbearance.
examples: the trials and tribulations of married life
synonyms: one's cross to bear; Morebore; informalpain
burr under someone's saddle "she could be a bit of a trial at times"trouble
misadventure; informalhassle; literarytravails "a long account of her trials and tribulations"

definitions.definition: test (something, especially a new product) to assess its suitability or performance.
examples: all seeds are carefully trialed in a variety of growing conditions

definitions.definition: (of a horse, dog, or other animal) compete in trials.
